name: Colorall (thamara)
description:
[Playing in full screen or downloading the game is suggested]

Colorall is a game where you need to grow your color blob by changing its color to match the adjacent tiles. When an adjacent tile is the same color as your blob, you absorb it.

Your goal is to completely take over the grid with your blob in any color... but you only have one minute.

Challenge yourself, beat all the levels and collect the achievements!

Playing

Play with the mouse directly on the browser (full screen is best), or download the executable.

If installing, extract both files to the same directory (the .exe and .pck) and run the executable.

Can you beat my high scores?

Credits

Colorall was developed with lots of love by Thamara Andrade for the One Minute Jam #5.

Music: "Algorithms" and "Space" by Chad Crouch (CC BY-NC 4.0)

Sounds: Interface sounds by Kenney (CC0 1.0 Universal)

Font: Supermercado One by James Grieshaber (OFL)

Thanks ❤

Huge thanks to the Bárbara, Daniel, Arthur and Hamilton who helped test and improve the game <3

Source code

Want to check the mess of a code written in a week by someone who is still learning game development? It's available in GitHub.
